meanings.definition: A cunning plan or action designed to turn a situation to one's own advantage.
meanings.sent1: Her clever ploy to distract the guard allowed her to sneak past unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: The politician's ploy to win over voters involved promising lower taxes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's ploy to make the rabbit disappear left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: His ploy to outsmart his opponent in the chess game was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The detective's ploy to catch the thief involved setting up a fake crime scene.

meanings.definition: A tactic intended to manipulate or deceive someone.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist's ploy to trick people into giving him money was quickly exposed.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his ploy to make her believe his false promises.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ploy to pretend to be asleep so it could catch the mouse was quite sneaky.
meanings.sent4: His ploy to hide his true intentions behind a friendly smile fooled no one.
meanings.sent5: The villain's ploy to frame the hero for the crime almost succeeded.
